meanings.definition: Most full of woe or sorrow
meanings.sent1: The wofullest day of the year is when the flowers wilt and the sky is gray.
meanings.sent2: She felt wofullest when her beloved pet passed away.
meanings.sent3: The wofullest puppy in the litter kept tripping over its own paws.
meanings.sent4: The wofullest melody played by the violinist brought tears to everyone's eyes.
meanings.sent5: The wofullest expression on his face showed the depth of his sadness.

meanings.sent1: The wofullest news she received was that her house had burned down.
meanings.sent2: The wofullest sight was the abandoned, dilapidated house at the end of the street.
meanings.sent3: The wofullest clown at the circus made everyone laugh with his clumsy antics.
meanings.sent4: The wofullest storm raged outside, shaking the windows with its fury.
meanings.sent5: The wofullest movie she watched left her feeling unsettled and anxious.
